003.name: Control Number Identifier (NR)
003.description: This field has no indicators or subfield codes.

006.name: Fixed-Length Data Elements-Additional Material Characteristics (R)
006.description: Field has no indicators or subfield codes; the data elements are positionally defined by form of material. Forms of material are listed in the same order that they appear in field 008 (Fixed-Length Data Elements). Refer to the corresponding positions (18-34) in field 008 for descriptions of field 006 character positions 01-17.

007.name: Physical Description Fixed Field-General Information (R)
007.description: Field has no indicators or subfield codes; the data elements are positionally defined by category of material. Categories of material are listed alphabetically by code.

008.name: Fixed-Length Data Elements-General Information (NR)
008.description: Character positions 00-17 and 35-39 are defined the same across all types of material, with special consideration for position 06. The definition of character positions 18-34 was done independently for each type of material, although certain data elements are defined the same in the specifications for more than one type of material. When similar data elements are defined for inclusion in field 008 for different types of material, they occupy the same field 008 character positions.

010.name: Library of Congress Control Number (NR)
010.description: The control number for MARC records distributed by LC is an LC control number (LCCN). The LC control number is carried in field 001 (Control Number) in records distributed by LC's Cataloging Distribution Service and in field 010$a. An organization using LC records may remove the LC control number from field 001 and use field 001 for its own system control number.

013.name: Patent Control Information (R)
013.description: Information used to control patent documents. In addition to information about patents, this field may contain information relating to inventors' certificates, utility certificates, utility models, patents or certificates of addition, inventors' certificates of addition, utility certificates of addition, and published applications for any of these.

d.name: Date
d.description: Date

015.name: National Bibliography Number (R)
015.description: Bibliography entry number(s) for cataloging information that is derived from a national bibliography. When cataloging information is derived from an entry in a national bibliography, the number of the entry is given in the record. A work may have more than one number from a single national bibliography or may have numbers from more than one national bibliography. Multiple numbers are recorded in repeating 015 fields.

q.name: Qualifying information
q.description: Volume numbers or other data that qualify a national bibliography number being recorded in subfield $a or subfield $z.

z.name: Canceled/invalid national bibliography number
z.description: Canceled or invalid (structurally or application) national bibliography number.

2.name: Source
2.description: Code that identifies the source of the National Bibliography Number. Code from: National Bibliography Number Source Codes..

6.name: Linkage
6.description: See description of this subfield in Appendix A: Control Subfields.

8.name: Field link and sequence number
8.description: See description of this subfield in Appendix A: Control Subfields.

016.name: National Bibliographic Agency Control Number (R)
016.description: Unique numbers that have been assigned to a record by a national bibliographic agency other than the Library of Congress. The control number may also appear in field 001 (Control Number) in records distributed by the same national agency. This number is a record control number used in a national bibliographic agency system, rather than a number used for an entry in a national bibliography, field 015 (National Bibliography Number).

2.name: Source
2.description: Source

017.name: Copyright or Legal Deposit Number (R)
017.description: Field is repeated when more than one agency has assigned a copyright or legal deposit number.

z.name:

Canceled/invalid copyright or legal
      deposit number

2.name: Source
2.description: Source

018.name: Copyright Article-Fee Code (NR)
018.description: $6 - Linkage See description of this subfield in Appendix A: Control Subfields.

020.name: International Standard Book Number (R)
020.description: Each field contains all the information relevant to one ISBN, or if no ISBN exists, relevant to the item being cataloged.

a.name: International Standard Book Number
a.description: Valid ISBN. ISBN and the embedded hyphens may be generated for display.

c.name: Terms of availability
c.description: Price or a brief statement of availability and any paranthetical qualifying information about availability.

q.name: Qualifying information
q.description: A brief statement of qualifying information concerning the item associated with a number being recorded in subfield $a or subfield $z.

z.name: Canceled/invalid ISBN
z.description: Canceled or invalid ISBN. ISBN (invalid) and the embedded hyphens may be generated for display.

6.name: Linkage
6.description: See description of this subfield in Appendix A: Control Subfields.

8.name: Field link and sequence number
8.description: See description of this subfield in Appendix A: Control Subfields.

022.name: International Standard Serial Number (R)
022.description: $y - Incorrect ISSN Incorrect ISSN that has been associated with the continuing resource. Each incorrect ISSN is contained in a separate subfield $y. A canceled ISSN is contained in subfield $z. ISSN (incorrect) may be generated for display. 022 0#$a0046-225X$y0046-2254

a.name: International Standard Serial Number
a.description: Valid ISSN for the continuing resource. ISSN may be generated for display.

y.name: Incorrect ISSN
y.description: Incorrect ISSN that has been associated with the continuing resource. Each incorrect ISSN is contained in a separate subfield $y. A canceled ISSN is contained in subfield $z.

z.name: Canceled ISSN
z.description: Canceled ISSN that is associated with the continuing resource. Each canceled ISSN is contained in a separate subfield $z.

0.name: Authority record control number or standard number
0.description: A URI for the ISSN in subfield $a.

1.name: Real World Object URI
1.description: See description of this subfield in Appendix A: Control Subfields.

2.name: Source
2.description: ISSN Center responsible for assigning and maintaining ISSNs and related data.

6.name: Linkage
6.description: See description of this subfield in Appendix A: Control Subfields.

8.name: Field link and sequence number
8.description: See description of this subfield in Appendix A: Control Subfields.

024.name: Other Standard Identifier (R)
024.description: Standard number or code published on an item which cannot be accommodated in another field (e.g., field 020 (International Standard Book Number), 022 (International Standard Serial Number) , and 027 (Standard Technical Report Number)). The type of standard number or code is identified in the first indicator position or in subfield $2 (Source of number or code).

c.name: Terms of availability
c.description: Price or a brief statement of availability and any paranthetical qualifying information about availability. Information is only recorded in this subfield when a number is present in subfield $a.

d.name: Additional codes following the standard number or code
d.description: Any optional digits carried to the right of the number or code, such as digits provided to identify price, title, or issue information.

q.name: Qualifying information
q.description: A brief statement of qualifying information concerning the item associated with a number being recorded in subfield $a or subfield $z.

z.name: Canceled/invalid standard number or code
z.description: Any canceled and/or invalid standard numbers or codes. If a valid number or code of the same type is not known, subfield $z may appear alone in field 024.

2.name: Source of number or code
2.description: MARC code that identifies the source of the number or code. Used only when the first indicator contains value 7 (Source specified in subfield $2).

6.name: Linkage
6.description: See description of this subfield in Appendix A: Control Subfields.

8.name: Field link and sequence number
8.description: See description of this subfield in Appendix A: Control Subfields.

025.name: Overseas Acquisition Number (R)
025.description: Used to record the acquisition source of the item and also identifies certain programs under which materials are acquired at LC. The following types of numbers are included in this field:

026.name: Fingerprint Identifier (R)
026.description: Guidelines used are identified in subfield $2 (Source). Fingerprints may be recorded in a parsed form by using subfields $a through $d or as a single string of characters in subfield $e.

a.name: First and second groups of characters
a.description: First and second groups of characters

b.name: Third and fourth groups of characters
b.description: Third and fourth groups of characters

d.name: Number of volume or part
d.description: Number of volume or part

2.name: Source
2.description: Source

027.name: Standard Technical Report Number (R)
027.description: $q - Qualifying information A brief statement of qualifying information concerning the item associated with a number being recorded in subfield $a or subfield $z.

q.name: Qualifying information
q.description: A brief statement of qualifying information concerning the item associated with a number being recorded in subfield $a or subfield $z.

z.name: Canceled/invalid number
z.description: Any canceled and/or invalid standard number.

6.name: Linkage
6.description: See description of this subfield in Appendix A: Control Subfields.

8.name: Field link and sequence number
8.description: See description of this subfield in Appendix A: Control Subfields.

028.name: Publisher or Distributor Number (R)
028.description: Formatted number used for sound recordings, printed music, other music-related materials, and video recordings. Publisher's and distributor's numbers that are given in an unformatted form are recorded in field 500 (General Note). A print constant identifying the kind of publisher or distributor number may be generated based on the value in the first indicator position. Repeatable for multiple numbers associated with an item.

b.name: Source
b.description: Source of the publisher or distributor number. Varies according to the type of publication and the type of number being recorded. For sound recordings and video recordings, label and distributor names are recorded in subfield $b.

q.name: Qualifying information
q.description: Contains qualifiers associated with the number such as part to which number pertains, where number found on item, etc.

6.name: Linkage
6.description: See description of this subfield in Appendix A: Control Subfields.

8.name: Field link and sequence number
8.description: See description of this subfield in Appendix A: Control Subfields.

030.name: CODEN Designation (R)
030.description: $z - Canceled/invalid CODEN If the valid CODEN is not known, subfield $z may be used alone in the record. 030 ##$aASIRAF$zASITAF

031.name: Musical Incipits Information (R)
031.description: $c - Number of excerpt Order of incipits within the movement defined in subfield $b. If there is only one incipit for a movement, use 1. 031 ##$c1[An incipit for the instrumental introduction of an aria.] 031 ##$c2[An incipit for the vocal part of an aria.]

d.name: Caption or heading
d.description: Caption or heading

p.name: Musical notation
p.description: Musical notation

q.name: General note
q.description: General note

2.name: System code
2.description: System code

032.name: Postal Registration Number (R)
032.description: When the serial title is no longer mailed at second class rates (e.g., because the publisher abandoned the second class authorization), field 032 is deleted from the MARC record.

033.name: Date/Time and Place of an Event (R)
033.description: Formatted date/time and/or coded place of creation, capture, recording, filming, execution, or broadcast associated with an event or the finding of a naturally occurring object. This information in textual form is contained in field 518 (Date/Time and Place of an Event Note).

a.name: Formatted date/time
a.description: Seventeen characters, recorded in the pattern yyyymmddhhmm+-hmm, that indicate the actual or approximate date (yyyymmdd)/time (hhmm) of capture, finding, or broadcast and Time Differential Factor (+-hhmm) information.

b.name: Geographic classification area code
b.description: Four to six character numeric code for the main geographic area associated with an item. The code consists of the appropriate classification number from the range G3190-G9980 derived from the Library of Congress Classification--Class G by dropping the letter G.

c.name: Geographic classification subarea code
c.description: Alphanumeric Cutter number for a geographic subarea, derived from the Library of Congress Classification-Class G or expanded Cutter number lists for place names. Cutter numbers for places in the United States are also published in Geographic Cutters.

p.name: Place of event
p.description: Place of event. May be in a controlled or uncontrolled form.

0.name: Authority record control number or standard number
0.description: Control number of the record for a controlled place term in subfield $p.

1.name: Real World Object URI
1.description: See description of this subfield in Appendix A: Control Subfields.

2.name: Source of term
2.description: MARC code that identifies the source of the term used in $p when it is from a controlled list.

3.name: Materials specified
3.description: Part of the described materials to which the field applies.

6.name: Linkage
6.description: See description of this subfield in Appendix A: Control Subfields.

8.name: Field link and sequence number
8.description: See description of this subfield in Appendix A: Control Subfields.

034.name: Coded Cartographic Mathematical Data (R)
034.description: Contains cartographic mathematical data, including scale, projection, and/or coordinates in coded form. For digital items, the coordinates can represent a bounding rectangle, the outline of the area covered and/or the outline of an interior area not covered. For celestial charts, it may also contain zone, declination data, and/or right ascension data, and/or equinox. For cartographic material, there should be an 034 field corresponding to each 255 field in a record.

a.name: Category of scale
a.description: One-character alphabetic code indicating the type of scale of the item.

b.name: Constant ratio linear horizontal scale
b.description: Denominator of the representative fraction for the horizontal scale.

c.name: Constant ratio linear vertical scale
c.description: Denominator of the representative fraction for the vertical scale of relief models and other three-dimensional cartographic items.

d.name: Coordinates - westernmost longitude
d.description: Coordinates - westernmost longitude

g.name: Coordinates - southernmost latitude
g.description: Subfields $d, $e, $f, and $g individually identify the four coordinates of the item. Subfield $d represents the westernmost extent of the item; subfield $e, the easternmost extent; subfield $f, the northernmost extent; and subfield $g, the southernmost extent.

h.name: Angular scale
h.description: Scale, if known, for celestial charts.

n.name: Right ascension - western limit
n.description: Subfields $j, $k, $m, and $n are used with celestial charts or celestial charts in atlases and contain the limits of the declination and the right ascension.

p.name: Equinox
p.description: Equinox or epoch for a celestial chart. Usually recorded in the form yyyy (year) according to the Gregorian calendar, but may include a decimal including the month in the form yyyy.mm (year-month).

r.name: Distance from earth
r.description: Distance of celestial bodies, such as planets or stars, from the Earth in light-years in star atlases.

s.name: G-ring latitude
s.description: Latitude of a point of the g-ring.

t.name: G-ring longitude
t.description: Longitude of a point of the g-ring.

x.name: Beginning date
x.description: Beginning of the time frame specific to the coordinates. The date is structured in the form of yyyymmdd. When no date is recorded, it is assumed that the coordinate information is current.

y.name: Ending date
y.description: Ending of the time frame specific to the coordinates. The date is structured in the form of yyyymmdd. When no date is recorded, it is assumed that the coordinate information is current.

z.name: Name of extraterrestrial body
z.description: Name of a planet or other extraterrestrial body specified when the coordinate data recorded in subfields $d, $e, $f and $g do not describe an entity on Earth.

0.name: Authority record control number or standard number
0.description: See description of this subfield in Appendix A: Control Subfields.

1.name: Real World Object URI
1.description: See description of this subfield in Appendix A: Control Subfields.

2.name: Source
2.description: MARC code that identifies the source of the data recorded in field 034. If different sources are recorded, separate fields should be used. Code from: Cartographic Data Source Codes.

3.name: Materials specified
3.description: Information that specifies the part of the entity to which the field applies.

6.name: Linkage
6.description: See description of this subfield in Appendix A: Control Subfields.

8.name: Field link and sequence number
8.description: See description of this subfield in Appendix A: Control Subfields.

035.name: System Control Number (R)
035.description: Control number of a system other than the one whose control number is contained in field 001 (Control Number), field 010 (Library of Congress Control Number) or field 016 (National Bibliographic Agency Control Number).

036.name: Original Study Number for Computer Data Files (NR)
036.description: Original study number assigned by the producer of the computer file. Introductory phrase Original study: may be generated based on the field tag.

037.name: Source of Acquisition (R)
037.description: If a stock number is present (subfield $a), source of stock number/acquisition information (subfield $b) is required.

a.name: Stock number
a.description: Numbers such as distributor, publisher, or vendor numbers for resources other than music, music-related, or audiovisual materials are also recorded in this subfield.

b.name: Source of stock number/acquisition
b.description: Name or abbreviation of the publisher, distributor, or vendor. Can contain full information relating to the name and address of the publisher, distributor, or vendor, including information that may also be found elsewhere in the record (e.g., in the imprint).

c.name: Terms of availability
c.description: Usually a price (and qualifying information such as time period or market) that is related to the other information in the field. Can contain information used to specify the price, such as the terms gratis, free, or N.T.

f.name: Form of issue
f.description: Terms describing binding or format of the item available for order. Does not include statements of coverage or type of subscriber; such information is included as qualifiers in subfield $c. The subfield is commonly used when more than one physical form is recorded, each with a separate price.

n.name: Note
n.description: Textual note pertaining to the acquisition of the item.

3.name: Materials specified
3.description: Part of the described materials to which the field applies.

5.name: Institution to which field applies
5.description: See description of this subfield in Appendix A: Control Subfields.

6.name: Linkage
6.description: See description of this subfield in Appendix A: Control Subfields.

8.name: Field link and sequence number
8.description: See description of this subfield in Appendix A: Control Subfields.

038.name: Record Content Licensor (NR)
038.description: $6 - Linkage See description of this subfield in Appendix A: Control Subfields.

040.name: Cataloging Source (NR)
040.description: MARC code for or the title of the description rules used in creating the record. The subfield may also be used to record the use of AACR 2-based manuals. Subfield $e may contain either the name of the rules or a MARC code designating the rules

d.name: Modifying agency
d.description: Modifying agency

042.name: Authentication Code (NR)
042.description: Field 042 is an agency-assigned data element.

043.name: Geographic Area Code (R)
043.description: Geographic area codes associated with an item. Code from: MARC Code List for Geographic Areas. The source of a local code in subfield $b is indicated in subfield $2. The source of codes in subfield $c is ISO 3166, Codes for the representation of names of countries and their subdivisions - Part 1 : Country codes or Part 2 : Country subdivision codes.

a.name: Geographic area code
a.description: Seven-character MARC code for a geographic area. Each geographic area code associated with an item is contained in a separate subfield $a.

b.name: Local GAC code
b.description: Code is formulated by attaching a local subentity code to an already established geographic area code. Each local GAC associated with an item is contained in a separate subfield $b. It is recommended that standard GACs also be included in subfield $a for international exchange and understanding.

c.name: ISO code
c.description: Code taken from the International Organization for Standardization's Codes for the representation of names of countries and their subdivisions - Part 1: Country codes or Part 2 : Country subdivision codes (ISO 3166).

0.name: Authority record control number or standard number
0.description: See description of this subfield in Appendix A: Control Subfields.

1.name: Real World Object URI
1.description: See description of this subfield in Appendix A: Control Subfields.

2.name: Source of local code
2.description: Source from which the local code was assigned. Used only when subfield $b is used to indicate a local GAC code.

6.name: Linkage
6.description: See description of this subfield in Appendix A: Control Subfields.

8.name: Field link and sequence number
8.description: See description of this subfield in Appendix A: Control Subfields.

044.name: Country of Publishing/Producing Entity Code (NR)
044.description: Source of subentity codes are indicated in subfield $2. Field is used in conjunction with 008/15-17 (Place of publication, production, or execution). The code in 008/15-17 is recorded in the first occurrence of subfield $a in field 044.

2.name: Source of local subentity code
2.description: Source of local subentity code

046.name: Special Coded Dates (R)
046.description: Guidelines on how to transcribe a date in subfields $b, $c, $d, and $e are generally the same as those specified under 008/06 (Type of date/Publication status), 008/07-10 (Date 1) and 008/11-14 (Date 2), except that incorrect dates and B.C.E. dates may be recorded only in field 046.

b.name: Date 1, B.C.E. date
b.description: Before Common Era (B.C.E.) Date 1 (type of date normally recorded in 008/07-10).

c.name: Date 1, C.E. date
c.description: Common Era (C.E.) Date 1 (type of date normally recorded in 008/07-10). In the case of an incorrect date 1, the incorrect date is recorded in field 046 while the corrected date is recorded in 008/07-10.

d.name: Date 2, B.C.E. date
d.description: B.C.E. Date 2 (type of date normally recorded in 008/11-14).

e.name: Date 2, C.E. date
e.description: C.E. Date 2 (type of date normally recorded in 008/11-14). In the case of an incorrect date 2, the incorrect date is recorded in field 046 while the corrected date is recorded in 008/11-14.

j.name: Date resource modified
j.description: Dates in subfield $j usually relate to Web pages and other electronic media that routinely contain the date of last update. The date and time are recorded according to Representations of Dates and Times (ISO 8601) unless subfield $2 (Source of date) specifies another date scheme.

k.name: Beginning or single date created
k.description: Date or beginning of the date range on which a resource has been created. Dates contained in subfield $k may or may not be coded elsewhere in the formats. The date is recorded as specified in subfield $j (Date resource modified).

l.name: Ending date created
l.description: Ending date of a date range on which a resource has been created. The date is recorded as specified in subfield $j (Date resource modified).

m.name: Beginning of date valid
m.description: Beginning of the date span for the validity of a resource. The date is recorded as specified in subfield $j (Date resource modified).

n.name: End of date valid
n.description: Ending of the date span for the validity of a resource. The date is recorded as specified in subfield $j (Date resource modified).

o.name: Single or starting date for aggregated content
o.description: Single or starting date of original release of the contents of a collection/aggregation.

p.name: Ending date for aggregated content
p.description: Ending date of original release of the contents of a collection/aggregation.

x.name: Nonpublic note
x.description: Note relating to the date(s) recorded in the field. The note is written in a form that is not adequate or intended for public display.

z.name: Public note
z.description: Note relating to the date(s) recorded in the field. The note is written in a form that is adequate or intended for public display. It is not intended to substitute for system programming that correctly parses the date information itself for display purposes.

2.name: Source of date
2.description: Source of the date scheme used in the field if not in the form yyyymmdd as specified in subfield $j (Date resource modified).

3.name: Materials specified
3.description: Part of the described materials to which the field applies.

6.name: Linkage
6.description: See description of this subfield in Appendix A: Control Subfields.

8.name: Field link and sequence number
8.description: See description of this subfield in Appendix A: Control Subfields.

047.name: Form of Musical Composition Code (R)
047.description: Codes that indicate the form of musical composition of printed and manuscript music and musical sound recordings when character positions 18 and 19 (Form of composition) of field 008 (Fixed-Length Data Elements) for music contains the code mu for multiple forms or for non-MARC codes. MARC codes are listed under field 008 Music, /18-19 (Form of composition).

2.name: Source of code
2.description: Source of code

048.name: Number of Musical Instruments or Voices Code (R)
048.description: Codes for the various types of instrumental and vocal combinations are listed in this section. The function of the instrumentalist or vocalist is represented by the choice of subfield code.

2.name: Source of code
2.description: Source of code

050.name: Library of Congress Call Number (R)
050.description: Classification or call number that is taken from Library of Congress Classification or LC Classification Additions and Changes. The brackets that customarily surround alternate class/call numbers are not carried in the MARC record; they may be generated based on the presence of repeated $a subfields.

a.name: Classification number
a.description: Classification number portion of the call number. The source of the classification number is Library of Congress Classification and the LC Classification-Additions and Changes. Subfield $a is repeated to record an alternative class number.

b.name: Item number
b.description: Item number portion of the call number. An item number is the Cutter, date, term, etc. that is added to a classification number to distinguish an item from any other item assigned the same classification number.

0.name: Authority record control number or standard number
0.description: See description of this subfield in Appendix A: Control Subfields.

1.description: See description of this subfield in Appendix A: Control Subfields.

3.name: Materials specified
3.description: Part of the described material to which the field applies. The subfield is used with archival-type materials; its use is parallel with the use of subfield $3 in other fields.

6.name: Linkage
6.description: See description of this subfield in Appendix A: Control Subfields.

8.name: Field link and sequence number
8.description: See description of this subfield in Appendix A: Control Subfields.

051.name: Library of Congress Copy, Issue, Offprint Statement (R)
051.description: Used only for such information assigned by the Library of Congress. The field does not include supplements, indexes, etc., which are related to, but not the same as, the item in the main record. This field is frequently used for Library of Congress publications when the first two copies are given a call number based on the subject of the publication and additional copies are given a call number assigned to publications of LC.

052.name: Geographic Classification (R)
052.description: Geographic classification code that represents the geographic area and, if applicable, the geographic subarea and populated place name covered by an item. Code can provide more precise geographic access than the codes contained in field 043 (Geographic Area Code). Each main geographic area code and any related subarea codes associated with the item are contained in a separate 052 field. Subfield $d (Populated Place Name) may contain the name of the geographic area.

a.name: Geographic classification area code
a.description: Numeric or alphanumeric code that represents the main geographic area covered by an item.

b.name: Geographic classification subarea code
b.description: Geographic subarea code related to the geographic area coded in subfield $a.

d.name: Populated place name
d.description: Approved form of name for a populated place.

0.name: Authority record control number or standard number
0.description: See description of this subfield in Appendix A: Control Subfields.

1.name: Real World Object URI
1.description: See description of this subfield in Appendix A: Control Subfields.

2.name: Code source
2.description: MARC code for the source of the geographic classification. Code from: Classification Scheme Source Codes.

6.description: See description of this subfield in Appendix A: Control Subfields.

8.description: See description of this subfield in Appendix A: Control Subfields.

055.name: Classification Numbers Assigned in Canada (R)
055.description: Excludes those numbers assigned from the National Library of Medicine classification system, the Universal Decimal Classification, and the Dewey Decimal Classification. These latter numbers are input in fields 060 (National Library of Medicine Call Number), 080 (Universal Decimal Classification Number), and 082 (Dewey Decimal Classification Number), respectively.

a.name: Classification number
a.description: Classification number portion of the call number. Alternate call numbers are recorded in separate 055 fields.

b.name: Item number
b.description: Item number portion of the call number.

0.description: See description of this subfield in Appendix A: Control Subfields.

1.description: See description of this subfield in Appendix A: Control Subfields.

2.description: Source of call/class number

6.description: See description of this subfield in Appendix A: Control Subfields.

8.description: See description of this subfield in Appendix A: Control Subfields.

060.name: National Library of Medicine Call Number (R)
060.description: Current practice is to record alternative call numbers in separate occurrences of field 060.

a.name: Classification number
a.description: Either the classification number portion of the call number or an accession number. Source of the classification number is National Library of Medicine Classification.

b.name: Item number
b.description: Item number portion of the NLM call number.

0.description: See description of this subfield in Appendix A: Control Subfields.

245.name: Title Statement (NR)
245.description: Title Statement field consists of the title proper and may also contain the general material designation (medium), remainder of title, other title information, the remainder of the title page transcription, and statement(s) of responsibility. The title proper includes the short title and alternative title, the numerical designation of a part/section and the name of a part/section.

a.name: Title
a.description: Title proper and alternative title, excluding the designation of the number or name of a part. Subfield $a also contains the first title of separate works (by the same or different authors/composers) in a collection lacking a collective title.

b.name: Remainder of title
b.description: Data includes parallel titles, titles subsequent to the first (in items lacking a collective title), and other title information. In records formulated according to ISBD principles, subfield $b contains all the data following the first mark of ISBD punctuation and up to and including the mark of ISBD punctuation that introduces the first author statement (i.e., the first slash (/)) or precedes either the number (subfield $n) or the name (subfield $p) of a part/section of a work.

c.name: Statement of responsibility, etc.
c.description: First statement of responsibility and/or remaining data in the field that has not been subfielded by one of the other subfield codes. In records formulated according to ISBD principles, subfield $c contains all data following the first slash (/).

f.name: Inclusive dates
f.description: Time period during which the entirety of the contents of the described materials were created.

g.name: Bulk dates
g.description: Time period during which the bulk of the described materials were created.

k.name: Form
k.description: Term that is descriptive of the form of the described materials, determined by an examination of their physical character, subject of their intellectual content, or the order of information within them (e.g., daybooks, diaries, directories, journals, memoranda, etc.).

n.name: Number of part/section of a work
n.description: Number designation for a part/section of a work used in a title. Numbering is defined as an indication of sequencing in any form, e.g., Part 1, Supplement A, Book two. In music titles, the serial opus, or thematic index number are generally not contained in subfield $n.

p.name: Name of part/section of a work
p.description: Name of a part/section of a work in a title. In records formulated according to ISBD principles, subfield $p data follows a period (.) when it is preceded by subfield $a, $b or another subfield $p. Subfield $p follows a comma (,) when it follows subfield $n.

s.name: Version
s.description: Name, code, or description of a copy of the described materials that was generated at different times or for different audiences.

For continuing resources, this field is not used for sequential edition statements such as 1st- ed. This type of information is contained in field 362 (Dates of Publication and/or Volume Designation).

b.description: Entire projection statement. In records formulated according to ISBD principles, subfield $b includes all data following the semicolon (;) and up to but not including the opening parenthesis (() that introduces subfields $c, $d, and/or $e.

c.name: Statement of coordinates
c.description: Coordinates are recorded in the order of westernmost longitude, easternmost longitude, northernmost latitude, and southernmost latitude. In records formulated according to ISBD principles, subfield $c data are enclosed in parentheses.

d.name: Statement of zone
d.description: Used for celestial charts.

e.name: Statement of equinox
e.description: Statement of equinox or epoch. In records formulated according to ISBD principles, subfield $e data, along with any subfield $c or $d data, are enclosed in parentheses.

f.name: Outer G-ring coordinate pairs
f.description: Coordinate pairs that identify the closed non-intersecting boundary of the area covered.

g.name: Exclusion G-ring coordinate pairs
g.description: Coordinate pairs that identify the closed non-intersecting boundary of the area contained within the G-polygon outer ring that is excluded.

260.name: Publication, Distribution, etc. (Imprint) (R)
260.description: For unpublished items or materials that are collectively controlled, this field may not be included in a record or may contain only subfield $c (Date of publication, distribution, etc.).

c.name: Date of publication, distribution, etc.
c.description: May contain multiple dates (e.g., dates of publication and copyright).

e.name: Place of manufacture
e.description: Place of manufacture and any additions to the place name. When subfield $e is recorded, subfield $f is also generally recorded. In records formulated according to ISBD principles, subfield $e is recorded after any subfield $a, $b, or $c.

f.name: Manufacturer
f.description: Name of the manufacturer and any qualifying terms. In records formulated according to ISBD principles, subfield $f contains all data following the last mark of ISBD punctuation (i.e., a colon (:)) and up to and including the mark of ISBD punctuation that introduces the next data element (a comma (,) when subfield $f is followed by subfield $g, a closing parenthesis ()) when subfield $f is the last subfield in field 260.

g.name: Date of manufacture
g.description: If the date of manufacture has been used in place of a date of publication in subfield $c, it is not recorded in subfield $g. In records formulated according to ISBD principles, subfield $g contains all data following a comma ( , ) when subfield $g follows subfield $f, and ends with a closing parenthesis ( ) ).

3.name: Materials specified
3.description: Information to differentiate the multiple statements of the described materials to which the field applies.

261.name: Imprint Statement for Films (Pre-AACR 1 Revised) (NR)
261.description: Name of the individual, company, or organization responsible for the work, either directly or as a sponsor. The producing company is defined as the organization or individual that exercises the immediate overall responsibility for the physical processes involved in making the audiovisual material. Subfield $a is repeated when two or more joint production companies are named and they are not joined by a phrase such as in cooperation with.

d.name: Date of production, release, etc.
d.description: Date of production, release, etc.

264.name: Production, Publication, Distribution, Manufacture, and Copyright Notice (R)
264.description: Statement relating to the publication, printing, distribution, issue, release, or production of a work. Information in field 264 is similar to information in field 260 (Publication, Distribution, etc. (Imprint)). Field 264 is useful for cases where the content standard or institutional policies make a distinction between functions

b.description: Name of producer, publisher, distributor, manufacturer

270.name: Address (R)
270.description: An address (as well as electronic access information such as email, telephone, fax, TTY, etc. numbers) for contacts related to the content of the bibliographic item. Multiple addresses, such as mailing addresses and addresses corresponding to the physical location of an item or facilities, are recorded in separate occurrences of field 270.

a.name: Address
a.description: All address information preceding the name of the city or town, except attention information which is recorded in subfields $f, $g, and $h. The subfield can also contain information indicating that no address information is available.

b.name: City
b.description: Name of the city or town.

c.name: State or province
c.description: Name of the state, province, or next larger jurisdiction, when this information is an integral part of the address.

d.name: Country
d.description: Country

e.name: Postal code
e.description: Alphanumeric code assigned the postal delivery area by a national postal agency.

f.name: Terms preceding attention name
f.description: Term of address associated with the attention name (e.g., General, Dr.) when the term precedes the name.

g.name: Attention name
g.description: Attention name, e.g., the name of a person.

h.name: Attention position
h.description: Position or terms of address associated with the attention name (e.g., Chief, M.D.) when the information follows the name.

i.name: Type of address
i.description: One or more words denoting the kind of address found in the field (e.g., "Billing"). Subfield $i is the first subfield in the field, unless subfield $6 is present.

j.name: Specialized telephone number
j.description: Important service number, as opposed to an administrative telephone number that is recorded in subfield $k. Examples of specialized telephone numbers include hotline numbers, toll-free numbers, emergency numbers, etc.

l.name: Fax number
l.description: Fax number associated with the address. If more than one fax number is associated with the address, each number is given in a separate subfield $l.

m.name: Electronic mail address
m.description: Electronic mail address associated with the address. If more than one electronic mail address is associated with the address, each number is given in a separate subfield $m.

n.name: TDD or TTY number
n.description: TDD or a TTY number associated with the address. If there is both a TDD number and a TTY number (and/or more than one of each) associated with the address, each number is given in a separate subfield $n.

p.name: Contact person
p.description: Name of a contact person at the address. If more than one contact person is associated with the address, each name is given in a separate subfield $p. If the name of the person is the same name as the attention name found in subfield $g, the information is not repeated in subfield $p.

q.name: Title of contact person
q.description: Title of contact person

r.name: Hours
r.description: Hours that access to the contact and/or telephone numbers is available. If the record is for a system or service, the hours it is available are recorded in field 307 (Hours, Etc.). This subfield is only for the hours associated with address information in field 270.

z.name: Public note
z.description: Note relating to the address information contained in field 270. The note is written in a form that is adequate for public display.

4.name: Relationship
4.description: Code or URI that specifies the relationship from the entity described in the record to the entity referenced in the field. More than one relationship code or URI may be used if there is more than one relationship. A source of relationship codes is: MARC Code List for Relators.

6.name: Linkage
6.description: See description of this subfield in Appendix A: Control Subfields.

8.name: Field link and sequence number
8.description: See description of this subfield in Appendix A: Control Subfields.

300.name: Physical Description (R)
300.description: Data in this field are customarily formulated as specified by various cataloging rules. In records formulated following cataloging rules based on International Standard Bibliographic Description (ISBD) principles, a relationship exists between prescribed ISBD punctuation and the identification of specific subfield data. Most of the examples in this section illustrate the prescribed ISBD punctuation associated with specific subfields.

a.name: Extent
a.description: Number of physical pages, volumes, cassettes, total playing time, etc., of each type of unit.

b.name: Other physical details
b.description: Physical characteristics such as illustrative matter, coloration, playing speed, groove characteristics, presence and kind of sound, number of channels, motion picture presentation format, etc.

c.name: Dimensions
c.description: Expressed in centimeters, millimeters, or inches; may include a parenthetical qualifier giving the format of the item (e.g., (fol.), (8vo)).

e.name: Accompanying material
e.description: May include a parenthetical physical description of the accompanying material.

f.name: Type of unit
f.description: Terms such as page, volumes, boxes, cu. ft., linear ft., etc. that are used to identify the configuration of material and how it is stored.

g.name: Size of unit
g.description: Size of a type of unit given in the preceding subfield $f.

3.name: Materials specified
3.description: Part of the described materials to which the field applies.

6.description: See description of this subfield in Appendix A: Control Subfields.

7.description: See description of this subfield in Appendix J: Data Provenance Subfields.

8.description: See description of this subfield in Appendix A: Control Subfields.

306.name: Playing Time (NR)
306.description: Playing time may also be recorded in natural language in a note (field 500 and/or 505) or in field 300 (Physical Description).

307.name: Hours, Etc. (R)
307.description: $a - Hours Days and/or hours an item is available or accessible. Informal references to the A.M. and P.M. time references as well as time zone can be given in this subfield if required. 307 ##$aM-F, 9AM-10PM. 307 ##$aTu-F, 10-6; Sa, 1-5, USA PST. 307 ##$aM, 8:30-6:00; Tu, 8:30-7:00; W-F, 8:30-6:00;$bnot available on weekends. 307 8#$a8:00 p.m., Tu-F; 5:00 and 9:00 p.m., Sa; 2:00 and 7:00 p.m., Su (all times, EST).

310.name: Current Publication Frequency (R)
310.description: In records having field 008 (Fixed-Length Data Elements) or field 006 (Fixed-Length Data Elements-Additional Material Characteristics) configured for seriality, field 362 information is related to coded information contained in 008/18 (006/01) (Frequency) and 008/19 (006/02) (Regularity). The date(s) of the current publication frequency is given when the beginning date of the current publication frequency is not the same as the beginning date of the publication.

a.name: Current publication frequency
a.description: Complete statement, exclusive of dates, of the current publication frequency.

b.name: Date of current publication frequency
b.description: Used when the date is different from the beginning date of the publication and a former publication frequency is given in field 321.

a.name: Former publication frequency

337.name: Media Type (R)
337.description: Media type reflects the general type of intermediation device required to view, play, run, etc., the content of a resource. Used as an alternative to or in addition to the coded expression of Media type in field 007/00 (Category of material). Field 337 information enables indication of more specific media types and media types from various lists.

a.name: Media type term
a.description: Term for the category of media used to convey the content of the resource.

b.name: Media type code
b.description: Code for the category of media used to convey the content of the resource.

338.name: Carrier Type (R)
338.description: Carrier type reflects the format of the storage medium and housing of a carrier in combination with the media type (which indicates the intermediation device required to view, play, run, etc., the content of a resource). Used as an alternative to or in addition to the coded expression of carrier type in field 007/01 (Specific material designation). Field 338 information enables indication of more specific carrier types and carrier types from various lists.

a.name: Carrier type term
a.description: Term for the category of carrier used to convey the content of the resource.

b.name: Carrier type code
b.description: Code for the category of carrier used to convey the content of the resource.

340.name: Physical Medium (R)
340.description: Coded physical information is contained in field 007 (Physical Description Fixed Field) and field 008 (Fixed-Length Data Elements).

a.name: Material base and configuration
a.description: Physical substance (e.g., acetate, canvas, clay, film, glass, vellum, or wood) and configuration (e.g., cartridge, chip, dot, fiche, globe, sheet, and audio-, magnetic-, micro-, ultra-, or videotape) on which the information is recorded.

b.name: Dimensions
b.description: Measurements of the material configuration (e.g., 35 mm. (film), 12 inch (phonograph disc), 4" x 6" (microfiche)).

c.name: Materials applied to surface
c.description: Physical substance applied to the material base (e.g., ink, oil, paint, specific photographic emulsions such as albumen).

d.name: Information recording technique
d.description: Means or technique by which information was recorded in or on the material base (e.g., punched, pressed, cut, molded, thermofax, x-ray).

e.name: Support
e.description: Physical material on or in which records are mounted, bound, or otherwise supported.

f.name: Reduction ratio value
f.description: A specific indication of the size of a micro-image in relation to the original from which it was produced. Most commonly, it is expressed numerically as a reduction ratio (e.g., 16:1, 90:1) or as a magnification value (e.g., 16x, 90x).

g.name: Color content
g.description: Color characteristics of the content of a resource. Achromatic values (white, gray, and black) are considered to be colors.

h.name: Location within medium
h.description: Location of the described materials within the material base and configuration (e.g., band, page, frame number).

j.name: Generation
j.description: The relationship between an original carrier and the carrier of a reproduction made from the original (e.g., a first generation camera master, a second generation printing master).

k.name: Layout
k.description: The arrangement of text, images, etc., in a resource.

l.name: Binding
l.description: A method used to bind a published or unpublished resource, or other binding information. May be recorded using a controlled term or other structured description. Additional unstructured (or textual) information on binding may be recorded in field 563 (Binding Information).

m.name: Book format
m.description: The result of folding a printed sheet to form a gathering of leaves (e.g., a sheet folded once to form a folio, twice to form a quarto, three times to form an octavo).

n.name: Font size
n.description: The size of the type used to represent the characters and symbols in a resource. Font size may be expressed in general terms (e.g., large print), or by specifying in addition the dimensions of the type measured in points (e.g., 20 point).

o.name: Polarity
o.description: The relationship of the colors and tones in an image to the colors and tones of the object reproduced (e.g., positive, negative).

p.name: Illustrative content
p.description: General and/or specific indication of the type or types of illustrative content present in a resource.

q.name: Reduction ratio designator
q.description: A general description of the size of a micro-image in relation to the original from which it was produced (e.g., low reduction, ultra high reduction). For such designations expressed in specific numerical terms, use subfield $f (Reduction ratio value).

344.name: Sound Characteristics (R)
344.description: Specifications relating to the encoding of sound or the absence of sound in a resource. Multiple values from the same source vocabulary may be recorded in the same field in separate occurrences of subfields. Terms from different source vocabularies are recorded in separate occurrences of the field.

a.name: Type of recording
a.description: The method used to encode audio content for playback (e.g., analog, digital).

b.name: Recording medium
b.description: The type of medium used to record sound on an audio carrier (e.g., magnetic, optical).

c.name: Playing speed
c.description: The speed at which an audio carrier must be operated to produce the sound intended.

d.name: Groove characteristic
d.description: The groove width of an analog disc or the groove pitch of an analog cylinder.

e.name: Track configuration
e.description: The configuration of the audio track on a sound-track film.

f.name: Tape configuration
f.description: The number of tracks on an audiotape.

g.name: Configuration of playback channels
g.description: The number of sound channels used to make a recording (e.g., one channel for a monophonic recording, two channels for a stereophonic recording).

h.name: Special playback characteristics
h.description: An equalization system, noise reduction system, etc., used in making an audio recording.

i.name: Sound content
i.description: Indication of the presence or absence of sound in a resource. Usually used for projected graphic resources, moving image resources, and their electronic equivalents.

345.name: Moving Image Characteristics (R)
345.description: Specifications relating to a moving image resource. Multiple values from the same source vocabulary may be recorded in the same field within separate subfield occurrences. Terms from different source vocabularies are recorded in separate occurrences of the field.

a.name: Presentation format
a.description: The format used in the production of a moving image (e.g., Cinerama, IMAX).

b.name: Projection speed
b.description: The speed at which a device must be operated to produce the moving image intended.

c.name: Aspect ratio value
c.description: A numerical ratio of the width to the height of a moving image.

d.name: Aspect ratio designator
d.description: A general description of the ratio of the width to the height of a moving image.

346.name: Video Characteristics (R)
346.description: Technical specifications relating to the encoding of video images in a resource. Multiple values from the same source vocabulary may be recorded in the same field in separate occurrences of subfield $a (Video format) and subfield $b (Broadcast standard). Terms from different source vocabularies are recorded in separate occurrences of the field.

a.name: Video format
a.description: A standard, etc., used to encode the analog video content of a resource.

b.name: Broadcast standard
b.description: A system used to format a video resource for television broadcast.

347.name: Digital File Characteristics (R)
347.description: Technical specification relating to the digital encoding of text, image, audio, video, and other types of data in a resource. This information could also be recorded in field 300 (Physical Description) $b (Other physical details). Multiple values from the same source vocabulary may be recorded in the same field in separate occurrences of subfields. Terms from different source vocabularies are recorded in separate occurrences of the field.

a.name: File type
a.description: A general type of data content encoded in a computer file.

b.name: Encoding format
b.description: A schema, standard, etc., used to encode the digital content of a resource.

c.name: File size
c.description: The number of bytes in a digital file.

d.name: Resolution
d.description: The clarity or fineness of detail in a digital image, expressed by the measurement of the image in pixels, etc.

e.name: Regional encoding
e.description: A code identifying the region of the world for which a digital file has been encoded which may prevent the file from being played on a player from a different region.

f.name: Encoded bitrate
f.description: The speed at which streaming audio, video, etc., is designed to play.

355.name: Security Classification Control (R)
355.description: Specifics pertaining to the security classification associated with the document, title, abstract, contents note, and/or the author. In addition, it can contain handling instructions and external dissemination information pertaining to the dissemination of the document, title, abstract, contents note, and author. The field may also contain downgrading or declassification data, the name of the classification system, and a country of origin code.

d.name: Downgrading or declassification event
d.description: Downgrading or declassification event

357.name: Originator Dissemination Control (NR)
357.description: Specifics pertaining to originator (i.e., author, producer) control of dissemination of the material in hand. Subfield $a contains a specific term denoting that the originator has control over the material.

362.description: Dates in this field may be identical to the information in fields 008/07-10 (Date 1) and/or 008/11-14 (Date 2). Incomplete, approximate, or questionable dates are not recorded in this field.

370.name: Associated Place (R)
370.description: A place associated with works and expressions, including place of origin. If place data is from a controlled vocabulary, the vocabulary is indicated in subfield $2 (Source of term).

c.name: Associated country
c.description: A country with which the work is identified. Dates that pertain to the country are recorded in subfields $s (Start period) and $t (End period).

f.name: Other associated place
f.description: Other or additional town, city, province, state, and/or country associated with works, and expressions. Dates associated with other place are recorded in subfields $s (Start period) and $t (End period).

g.name: Place of origin of work or expression
g.description: The place(s) from which a work or expression originated. Dates associated with place of origin of work or expression are recorded in subfields $s (Start period) and $t (End period).

i.name: Relationship information
i.description: Designation of a relationship between the associated place recorded in the 370 field and the resource described in the 1XX/245 of the record. This may be an uncontrolled textual phrase or a controlled textual value from a list of relationships between bibliographic resources.

s.name: Start period
s.description: The starting date of association with a particular place by a work, or expression.

t.name: End period
t.description: The end date of association with a particular place by a work, or expression.

u.name: Uniform Resource Identifier
u.description: Uniform Resource Identifier (URI), for example a URL or URN, which provides electronic access data in a standard syntax. This data can be used for automated access to an electronic item using one of the Internet protocols.

v.description: Source where the information recorded in field 370 was found if not through a URI.

382.description: Second Indicator - Access control # - No information provided 0 - Not intended for access The field will not be indexed. 1 - Intended for access The field will be indexed.

a.name: Medium of performance
a.description: A term that indicates the instrumental, vocal, and/or other medium of performance.

b.name: Soloist
b.description: Medium of performance term for a soloist (a featured instrument or voice accompanied by an ensemble).

d.name: Doubling instrument
d.description: Term for the medium of performance an individual performer plays in addition to the primary medium of performance in preceding subfield $a, $b, or $p. Multiple doubling instruments may be recorded in separate occurrences of subfield $d.

e.name: Number of ensembles of the same type
e.description: Number of ensembles named in the preceding subfield. Use after $a (Medium of performance) or $p (Alternative medium of performance).

n.name: Number of performers of the same medium
n.description: Number of performers of the medium named in the preceding subfield. Use after subfield $a (Medium of performance), $b (Soloist), $d (Doubling instrument), or $p (Alternative medium of performance).

p.name: Alternative medium of performance
p.description: Term for an alternative medium of performance, given as an alternative to its primary medium of performance in preceding subfield $a, $b, or $d. Multiple alternate instruments may be recorded in separate occurrences of subfield $p.

r.name: Total number of individuals performing alongside ensembles
r.description: The total number of individual performers given in all instances of subfield $a and subfield $b needed to perform in the musical work/expression alongside one or more ensembles. Use subfield $s to record total number of individual performers when no ensembles are involved.

s.name: Total number of performers
s.description: Total number of performers needed to perform in the musical work/expression.

t.name: Total number of ensembles
t.description: The total number of ensembles needed to perform in the musical work/expression.

v.name: Note
v.description: Note for information that is not kept otherwise in the subfields of the field. May contain a description of the relationship between an alternative medium of performance and its primary medium of performance, or other textual information.

e.description: Brief identification of publisher associated with number recorded in $b. Used only where different publishers assigned different opus numbers to the same work or expression, or when different publishers assign the same opus number to different works or expressions.

505.description: Titles of separate works or parts of an item or the table of contents. The field may also contain statements of responsibility and volume numbers or other sequential designations.

506.name: Restrictions on Access Note (R)
506.description: For published works, this field contains information on limited distribution. For continuing resources, the restrictions must apply to all issues. If a note merely indicates the intended audience of a publication and does not imply restrictions on access, it is recorded in field 521 (Target Audience Note.) Terms governing the use of materials after access has been allowed are recorded in field 540 (Terms Governing Use and Reproduction).

a.name: Terms governing access
a.description: Legal, physical, or procedural restrictions imposed on individuals wishing to see the described materials.

b.name: Jurisdiction
b.description: Name of a person, an institution, or a position or function within the institution, by whom or which the terms governing access are imposed and/or enforced, and to whom the restriction may be appealed.

d.name: Authorized users
d.description: Class of users or specific individuals (by name or title) to whom the restrictions in subfield $a do not apply.

e.name: Authorization
e.description: Source of authority for the restriction.

f.name: Standardized terminology for access restriction
f.description: Data taken from a standardized list of terms indicating the level or type of restriction.

g.name: Availability date
g.description: Date when the resource changes its access status, e.g., when it becomes freely available. Preferred structure for the date is according to Date and Time (ISO 8601): yyyymmdd.

q.name: Supplying agency
q.description: A MARC Organization Code, ISIL, or textual name of the organization or project responsible for the data in the field.

u.name: Uniform Resource Identifier
u.description: Uniform Resource Identifier (URI), for example a URL or URN, which provides electronic access data in a standard syntax. The data that is accessed by the URI contains additional information about access restrictions.

When a distinction between levels of detail is required, a brief summary is given in subfield $a and a fuller annotation is given in subfield $b. The text is sometimes displayed and/or printed with an introductory term that is generated as a display constant based on the first indicator value.

a.description: Text of the summary, abstract, review, etc. When no distinction between levels of detail in the text is required, subfield $a contains all the text. When a distinction is appropriate, subfield $a contains a brief statement, with additional information being provided in subfield $b.

e.description: Any physical description information about the reproduction. It normally contains the number of physical pieces and the dimensions of the reproduction. The polarity, when negative, is recorded in subfield $e as other physical details following the number of pieces and preceding the dimensions.

662.name: Subject Added Entry-Hierarchical Place Name (R)
662.description: $a - Country or larger entity Name of a country or a larger political jurisdiction. It also contains the names of geographical areas/entities such as continents or hemispheres at a country level or higher. Subfield $a may be repeated for hierarchies when multiple levels are given, retaining the order highest-to-lowest. 662 ##$aAntarctica.$2lcsh 662 ##$aJapan$cHokkaido$gAsahi-dake.$2peakbag 662 ##$aWorld$aAsia$bJapan$gHokkaido (island)$gHokkaido (region)$cHokkaido (prefecture)$gAsahi-Dake.$2tgn

a.name: Country or larger entity
a.description: Name of a country or a larger political jurisdiction. It also contains the names of geographical areas/entities such as continents or hemispheres at a country level or higher. Subfield $a may be repeated for hierarchies when multiple levels are given, retaining the order highest-to-lowest.

b.name: First-order political jurisdiction
b.description: Name of a first-order political jurisdiction or division and, depending on the country, can include the names of states, provinces, territories, dpartements, etc.

c.name: Intermediate political jurisdiction
c.description: Name of a second-order or lower political jurisdiction or division but not including towns or cities, and, depending on the country, can include the names of counties, islands, municipalities, prefectures, regions, etc.

d.name: City
d.description: Name of a city or town.

e.name: Relator term
e.description: Designation of the relationship between a hierarchical place name and the described materials.

f.name: City subsection
f.description: Name of a smaller unit within a populated place, e.g., neighborhoods, parks or streets.

g.name: Other nonjurisdictional geographic region and feature
g.description: Name of a terrestrial nonjurisdictional geographic entity, e.g., rivers, lakes, islands, mountains, etc. Subfield $g may be repeated for hierarchies when multiple levels are given, retaining the order highest-to-lowest.

h.name: Extraterrestrial area
h.description: Name of any extraterrestrial entity or space and includes solar systems, galaxies, star systems, and planets as well as geographic features of individual planets, etc. Subfield $h may be repeated for hierarchies when multiple levels are given, retaining the order highest-to-lowest.

754.name: Added Entry-Taxonomic Identification (R)
754.description: Added entry in which the entry element is the taxonomic name or category associated with the described item. Subfields $a and $2 are always used.

a.name: Taxonomic name
a.description: Taxonomic names conform to the syntax controls of the taxonomic classification system identified in subfield $2. Subfield $a is repeatable for each taxonomic name associated with the item. Subfield $a is preceded by subfield $c, which indicates the taxonomic hierarchical category to which the name belongs.

c.name: Taxonomic category
c.description: Taxonomic category to which the name in subfield $a belongs. The terms used in this subfield are specified by the thesaurus identified in subfield $2. Subfield $c always precedes the data with which it is associated.

d.name: Common or alternative name
d.description: Common or alternative name to which the name in subfield $a belongs. Subfield $d may refer to one or multiple occurrences of subfield $a.

x.name: Non-public note
x.description: Note that is not displayed to the public.

z.name: Public note
z.description: Note relating to the taxonomic identification written in a form that is adequate or intended for public display.

857.name: Electronic Archive Location and Access (R)
857.description: Field 857 is repeated when an electronic resource has been stored in more than one Web archive or digital archive repository.

b.name: Name of archiving agency
b.description: Agency responsible for the Web archive or digital archive repository.

c.name: Name of Web archive or digital archive repository
c.description: The name by which the Web archive or digital archive repository is known.

d.name: Date range of archived material
d.description: The subfield is intended primarily for archived electronic continuing resources and other dynamic resources to provide information about the range of dates during which the archived material was issued.

f.name: Archive completeness
f.description: The subfield is intended primarily for archived electronic continuing resources or other archived dynamic resources. It contains information about how often or how many times an electronic continuing resource has been harvested.

g.name: Persistent identifier
g.description: Persistent identifier (PID) which enables search and retrieval of a resource from a Web archive or digital archive repository using existing Internet protocols. It is assigned to the resource for automated access and other resolution services by a PID resolver.

h.name: Non-functioning Uniform Resource Identifier
h.description: Uniform Resource Identifier (URI), for any archive or repository that has ceased to exist. Subfield $h may be repeated if there is more than one non-functioning URI. A note on the status change (including the date) may be added in either subfield $x or subfield $z, depending on the local policy.

l.name: Standardized information governing access
l.description: The subfield contains standardized information about the access status of a resource. The information may be in the form of a value from a controlled vocabulary, or a Uniform Resource Identifier (URI).

m.name: Contact for access assistance
m.description: Name of a contact for assistance in accessing a resource at the host specified in subfield $b. For addresses relating to the content of the resource itself (i.e. the item represented by the title recorded in field 245) rather than access assistance, field 270 is used.

n.name: Terms governing access
n.description: The subfield contains textual information about the access status of a resource.

q.name: Electronic format type
q.description: Identification of the electronic format type and version. Electronic format type should be specified with a code from the list of registered Internet Media Types (MIME types), taken from: IANA Media Types.

r.name: Standardized information governing use and reproduction
r.description: The subfield contains standardized information about the use and reproduction rights of a resource. The information may be in the form of a value from a controlled vocabulary, or a Uniform Resource Identifier (URI).

s.name: File size
s.description: Size of the file(s) as stored in the archive indicated in subfield $c. It is generally expressed in terms of 8-bit bytes (megabytes, gigabytes).

t.name: Terms governing use and reproduction
t.description: The subfield contains textual information about the use and reproduction rights of a resource.

u.name: Uniform Resource Identifier
u.description: Uniform Resource Identifier (URI), which provides standard syntax for locating an object using existing Internet protocols or by resolution of a persistent identifier (PID). Subfield $u may be repeated if more than one URI is recorded.

x.name: Nonpublic note
x.description: Note relating to the electronic location of the source identified in the field. The note is written in a form that is not adequate or intended for public display. It may also contain processing information about the file at the location specified.

y.name: Link text
y.description: Used for display in place of the URL in subfield $u. When subfield $y is present, applications should use the contents of subfield $y as the link instead of the content of subfield $u when linking to the destination in subfield $u.

z.name: Public note
z.description: Note relating to the electronic location of the source identified in the field. The note is written in a form that is adequate or intended for public display.

2.name: Access method
2.description: Access method when the first indicator position contains value 7. Code from: Electronic Access Methods Code List.

3.name: Materials specified
3.description: Part of the described material to which the field applies

5.name: Institution to which field applies
5.description: See description of this subfield in Appendix A: Control Subfields.

6.name: Linkage
6.description: See description of this subfield in Appendix A: Control Subfields.

7.name: Access status
7.description: Code indicating the availability of access to the networked electronic resource the address of which appears in subfield $g and/or subfield $u. Subfield $7 applies to all subfields $g and $u present in the field.

8.name: Field link and sequence number
8.description: See description of this subfield in Appendix A: Control Subfields.
